concept-wr.title: Software Installation Workflow
concept-wr.shortdesc: Installing the Titanium Server software involves initializing and configuring a combined controller/compute node a controller node, and then using this node to initialize and configure a second controller/compute node other hosts.

conbody.p: Normally, the controller is initialized using a local device, and the remaining hosts are initialized from the controller using PXE boot. If you prefer, you can also initialize the controller using PXE boot. For more information, see .

For a standard system with Controller Dedicated storage, the following procedure is recommended:
CGTS-4485 power off all hosts to startPower off all nodes in the cluster.
Install the first controller node.
Install the second controller node, and then configure its interfaces and Cinder storage.
Install the storage nodes.
Configure provider networks (required in order to add data interfaces on the compute nodes).
Install each compute node, and configure its interfaces and local storage.

For a CPE system, the following procedure is recommended:
CGTS-4485 power off all hosts to startPower off both nodes.
Install the first controller/compute node.
Configure provider networks (required in order to add data interfaces for the compute function).
Configure the first controller/compute node with data interfaces.
US68057 added stepConfigure local storage for the compute function on the first controller/compute node.
Install the second controller/compute node, and then configure its interfaces, Cinder storage, and local storage.

note.p: To ensure you can correctly identify hosts as you install them, power on and configure each new host one at a time.

conbody.p: To prevent a host from repeatedly booting over the network, you may need to adjust the boot order for the host. For more information, see . Terminal-server access to the hosts may be required to adjust the BIOS boot settings
After each host is configured, you can unlock it to make it operational.
US68057, US64033 add the steps to unlock controllersTo unlock a controller/compute controller node, you must do the following:

li.p: Manually configure the OAM network interface, and the infrastructure network interface if used. This is required for the secondary controller only.
Manually configure the Cinder storage. This is required for the secondary controller only.
Configure the data interfaces. This is required for each of the controllers.
Configure local storage for the compute function. This is required for each of the controllers.

conbody.p:
To unlock a compute node, you must do the following:
Define at least one provider network. You must do this before you can configure the compute node data interfaces.
Configure the data interfaces.
Optionally, configure the infrastructure interface. This is required only if an infrastructure network is defined.
US68057 add step for nova-local configurationConfigure local storage on the compute node.

To unlock a storage node, you must do the following:
Configure the storage volumes.
Configure the infrastructure interface.
For complete installation instructions, refer to Titanium Server Installation for your system (CPE system, system with controller storage, or system with dedicated storage).
